name: Janay Harris
summary: Computer Science student at WGU with experience in full-stack development, blockchain technology, and AI programming. Started coding in childhood with HTML and CSS on Geocities. Passionate about Python development, problem-solving, and continually learning new technologies.

degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
coursework: Object Oriented Programming, Artificial Intelligence, Algorithms, Data Structures, Linux

details: Second phase of the AWS AI/ML Scholarship program

description: Selected for the AI4ALL Ignite Program, a nationally recognized initiative launched at Stanford to support diverse emerging AI talent
Participating in a 13-week applied machine learning project and 7-week career readiness sprint focused on real-world impact and industry collaboration
Receiving mentorship from AI professionals while developing skills in model development, responsible AI practices, and industry-standard tools
Supported fundraising efforts through donor research and podcast editing.
Focused on nonprofit initiatives with no blockchain or AI responsibilities.
Built backend features using Python and FastAPI.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to deliver project milestones.
Built blockchain-based applications using React, Node.js, and MongoDB.
Developed smart contracts using Solidity (Ethereum) and Cadence (Flow).

name: Windows XP-Themed Portfolio
description: Created a portfolio using SvelteKit with a nostalgic Windows XP desktop theme, showcasing creative web development skills and user interface design.

name: Floragaze: AI Image Classifier
description: Developed an AI image classifier using PyTorch to identify flower species with 85% accuracy
Utilized Python for data preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deployment
Implemented a convolutional neural network (CNN) to classify flower images accurately
Created a user-friendly command-line interface (CLI) tool and Jupyter Notebook for training, evaluating, and predicting flower species
Optimized model performance by fine-tuning hyperparameters, improving accuracy and runtime efficiency

name: Rust Interpreter
description: Built a programming language interpreter in Rust as part of the 'Build Your Own Interpreter' challenge on CodeCrafters, demonstrating systems programming skills and language design understanding.

name: ELF Generator for x86_64
description: Developed a low-level ELF (Executable and Linkable Format) file generator for x86_64 architecture, showcasing skills in systems programming and understanding of binary formats.

name: Gaussian-Binomial Distribution Package
description: Developed a Python package for calculating and visualizing probability distributions, specifically Gaussian and Binomial distributions, with methods for statistical analysis.

name: AI-Powered Japanese Language Learning System
description: Designed and implemented a multi-phase language learning tool using LangGraph, Azure Speech SDK, and Google Cloud Vertex AI.
Incorporated RAG, vector search, pronunciation scoring, and agentic workflows.

name: Matcha Knowledge Chatbot
description: Built a custom chatbot using OpenAI, vector embeddings, and semantic search.
Utilized a matcha knowledge dataset to demonstrate RAG capabilities.

name: LoRA Fine-Tuning for Sequence Classification
description: Applied parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) using Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) on a Hugging Face transformer model.
Improved sequence classification performance on a custom dataset while minimizing computational costs and preserving model generalization.
Compared baseline model performance with LoRA-finetuned results and documented findings.

name: Portfolio Bot
description: An AI-powered chatbot built by Janay Harris using LangChain and RAG architecture.
It serves as a conversational assistant on her portfolio to help others explore her experience, projects, and skills.
It was designed to simulate a personable version of her digital presence.

name: AWS AI & ML Scholarship
details: Awarded Phase 1 of the AWS AI & ML Scholarship Program and selected for Phase 2 to complete the AWS Machine Learning Foundations Nanodegree, focusing on core ML concepts and cloud deployment.

name: Next Generation Tech Booster Scholarship
details: Selected for Phase 2 of the Bertelsmann Tech Booster Scholarship, advancing technical expertise through a Nanodegree program focused on cloud, data, or AI technologies.

organization: National Society of Leadership and Success (NSLS)

description: Focused on applied AI/ML through academic training, industry-recognized programs, and end-to-end project execution
details: Completed Udacity nanodegrees in AI Programming with Python and Generative AI, covering foundational ML and GenAI methods
Advanced to Phase 2 of the AWS AI/ML Scholarship, completing the AWS Machine Learning Foundations Nanodegree
Built Floragaze, an AI-powered image classifier using PyTorch that achieved 85% accuracy on flower species
Selected for the AI4ALL Ignite Program, contributing to a 13-week machine learning project with mentorship from AI professionals
Developed RAG-based chatbots and LoRA-finetuned models as part of the Bertelsmann Next Generation Tech Booster scholarship
Completed a Kaggle GenAI Capstone, showcasing a complete STT → RAG → LLM → TTS pipeline with Azure Speech and Vertex AI
Currently building a Japanese AI language school, integrating real-time speech scoring and OpenCV-based kana stroke recognition
Applied deep learning, transformer fine-tuning, and model evaluation across diverse, production-level projects

description: Gained hands-on blockchain development experience through freelance projects with a focus on NFT ecosystems and decentralized platforms.
details: Developed and deployed smart contracts on Ethereum using Solidity
Created resource-oriented smart contracts on Flow using Cadence
Worked with Binance Smart Chain (BSC) during early 2021, primarily building NFT-based applications and supporting some coin-related functionality
Built and maintained full-stack decentralized applications (dApps) with a focus on usability and stability
Contributed to NFT staking and rewards features inspired by Uniswap's ecosystem and community tools
Earned the Chainlink Fundamentals Certification, demonstrating practical knowledge of decentralized oracle networks
Completed a Blockchain and Smart Contract Security certification, focusing on smart contract vulnerabilities and best practices

description: Built systems-level projects across C, C++, and Rust to strengthen low-level programming foundations.
details: Developed an ELF binary generator for the x86_64 architecture to understand executable file formats and linking
Created a language interpreter in Rust with custom parsing and execution logic
Completed a C programming course with multiple assignments focused on memory management and pointer operations
Built a project in C++ applying object-oriented design and memory safety concepts
Explored in-memory data storage by starting a Redis-like key-value store in Rust

early_life: Passionate about computers and the internet since childhood, starting with a pixel art portfolio hosted on Geocities, coded in HTML and CSS
career_transition: After working in various roles including logistics, healthcare, and customer service, returned to programming in 2021 after deciding to pursue a more fulfilling technical career
education_path: Currently pursuing a BS in Computer Science at WGU, while completing specialized AI/ML nanodegrees from Udacity, including the AWS ML Fundamentals program
professional_growth: Progressed from freelance work to gaining more specialized experience in development, particularly in blockchain, AI applications, and systems programming

skills: Known for being collaborative, supportive in peer coding sessions, and regularly praised for communication.
Proficient in using Git and GitHub for version control and collaboration.
strengths: Restorative: Thrives on solving problems and reviving broken systems.
Learner: Finds energy in the process of learning and improving.
Belief: Anchored by strong core values.
Responsibility: Takes ownership of commitments with dedication.
Futuristic: Inspired by what could be, driven to shape the future.
